6.verse: If anyone does not abide in me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and withers; men gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

7.verse: If you abide in me and my words abide in you, ask whatever you wish and it will be done for you.

8.verse: My Father is glorified in this, that you bear much fruit and become my disciples.

9.verse: As the Father has loved me, I have also loved you; abide in my love.

10.verse: If you keep my commandments, you will abide in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.

11.verse: These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.

12.verse: “This is my commandment: Love one another, as I have loved you.

13.verse: Greater love has no one than this, that a person lays down his life for his friends.

14.verse: You are my friends if you do the things I command you.

15.verse: No longer do I call you servants, for a servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, because all that I have heard from my Father I have made known to you.

16.verse: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit and that your fruit should remain, so that the Father may give you whatever you ask in my name.

17.verse: These things I command you, so that you may love one another.

18.verse: “If the world hates you, be aware that it has hated me before it hated you.

19.verse: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own; but because you do not belong to the world, but I chose you out of the world, for this reason the world hates you.

20.verse: Remember the saying that I told you, ‘The servant is not greater than his master.’ If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my word, they will keep yours as well.

21.verse: But all these things they will do to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.

22.verse: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

23.verse: The one who hates me hates my Father also.

24.verse: If I had not done among them the works that no one else had done, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have seen the works and have hated both me and my Father.

25.verse: However, the word that is written in their law had to be fulfilled: ‘They hated me without a cause.’

26.verse: “But when the Paraclete comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who comes forth from the Father, he will bear witness about me.

27.verse: And you also are to bear witness because you have been with me from the beginning.

1.verse: “I have told you these things so that you will not fall away.

2.verse: They will put you out of the synagogues; indeed, the hour is coming when anyone who kills you will think he is offering a service to God.

3.verse: And these things they will do because they have not known the Father nor me.

4.verse: But I have said these things to you so that when their hour comes you will remember that I told you about them. “I did not tell you these things at the start because I was with you.

5.verse: But now I am going away to the one who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

6.verse: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

7.verse: Nevertheless I am telling you the truth; it is to your advantage that I am going away. For if I do not go away, the Paraclete will not come to you; but if I go away, I will send him to you.

8.verse: And he, when he comes, will convict the world in regard to sin and righteousness and judgment:

9.verse: in regard to sin, because they do not believe in me;

10.verse: in regard to righteousness, because I am going away to the Father, and you will see me no longer;

11.verse: in regard to judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.

12.verse: “I have many more things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.

13.verse: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak on his own, but will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you things yet to come.

14.verse: He will glorify me, for he will receive what is mine and tell it to you.

15.verse: All that the Father has is mine; that is why I said that he will take what is mine and declare it to you.

16.verse: “A little while and you will no longer see me, and again a little while and you will see me.”

17.verse: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, “What is this that he is saying to us, ‘A little while and you will not see me, and again a little while and you will see me’ and, ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”

18.verse: So they kept saying, “What is this ‘little while’ of which he speaks? We do not understand what he is talking about.”

19.verse: Jesus knew that they wanted to question him, so he said to them, “Are you deliberating with one another about this—that I said, ‘A little while and you will not see me, and again a little while and you will see me’?

20.verse: I tell you the solemn truth, you will weep and wail, and the world will rejoice; you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

21.verse: When a woman is giving birth, she has sorrow because her hour has come; but when the baby is born, she no longer remembers the anguish, because of the joy that a child has been born into the world.

22.verse: So for now you have sorrow; but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.

23.verse: On that day you will question me about nothing. I tell you the solemn truth: whatever you ask of the Father in my name he will give to you.

24.verse: Up till now you have asked for nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be complete.

25.verse: “I have told you these things using veiled language. The hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in veiled language but will tell you plainly about the Father.

26.verse: In that day you will ask in my name. I am not saying to you that I will intercede with the Father on your behalf;

27.verse: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have come to believe that I came forth from God.

28.verse: I came forth from the Father and have entered into the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”

29.verse: His disciples said, “Ah, now you are speaking plainly and not using veiled language!

30.verse: Now we know that you know all things and have no need for anyone to question you. This is why we believe that you have come forth from God.”

31.verse: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?

32.verse: Behold, the hour is coming, indeed it has come, when you will be scattered, each to his own place, and you will leave me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

33.verse: I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation, but take courage, I have conquered the world.”

1.verse: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he lifted up his eyes to heaven and said, “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son so that your Son may glorify you,

2.verse: since you have given him authority over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to all those you have given to him.

3.verse: And this is eternal life, that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom you sent.

4.verse: I glorified you on earth, having completed the task that you gave me to do;

5.verse: and now, Father, glorify me at your side with the glory that I had with you before the world began.

6.verse: “I have made your name known to the men whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have kept your word.

7.verse: Now they have come to know that everything that you have given me is from you;

8.verse: for the words that you gave to me I have given to them, and they have received them, and come to know in truth that I came forth from you, and they have believed that you sent me.

9.verse: I am praying for them; I am not praying for the world, but for those whom you have given to me, for they are yours;

10.verse: and all mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I have been glorified in them.

11.verse: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am on my way to you. Holy Father, keep them in your name, the name that you have given me, so that they may be one, just as we are one.

12.verse: While I was with them, I protected them in your name, which you have given me. I guarded them, and not one of them has been lost except the son of destruction, that the scripture might be fulfilled.

13.verse: But now I am on my way to you, and I am saying these things while still in the world that they may have my joy made complete in themselves.

14.verse: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.

15.verse: I am not asking that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from the evil one.

16.verse: They do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.

17.verse: Consecrate them by the truth; your word is truth.

18.verse: As you sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.

19.verse: And for their sake I consecrate myself, that they also may be consecrated by the truth.

20.verse: “It is not only for these that I am interceding, but also for those who will come to believe in me through their word,

21.verse: that they may all be one, just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you, that they also may be in us, so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

22.verse: And the glory that you have given me I have given them, so that they may be one just as we are one,

23.verse: I in them and you in me, that they may be completely one, so that the world may know that you sent me, and that you love them even as you love me.

24.verse: Father, I desire that those also, whom you have given me, may be with me where I am, so they may see my glory that you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.

25.verse: Righteous Father, although the world does not know you, I know you, and these men know that you sent me.

26.verse: I have made known to them your name, and I will continue to make it known, so that the love with which you have loved me may be in them, and I in them.”

1.verse: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples across the Kidron valley, where there was an olive grove, into which he entered with his disciples.

2.verse: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with his disciples.

3.verse: So Judas, having procured a detachment of soldiers and some officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, went there with lanterns and torches and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, knowing everything that was going to happen to him, stepped forward and said to them, “Who is it that you are looking for?”

5.verse: They answered him, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He said to them, “I am he.” Now Judas, who betrayed him, was standing with them.

6.verse: When Jesus said to them, “I am he,” they all drew back and fell to the ground.

7.verse: Then Jesus asked them again, “Who is it that you are looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”

8.verse: Jesus replied, “I told you that I am he. So if you are looking for me, let these men go.”

9.verse: This was to fulfill the word that he had spoken, “I have not lost a single one of those whom you have given me.”

10.verse: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

11.verse: Jesus therefore said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath. Am I not to drink the cup which the Father has given me?”

12.verse: So the detachment of soldiers, their captain, and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound him.

13.verse: They took him first to Annas, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

14.verse: Caiaphas was the man who had advised the Jews that it was to their advantage that one man die for the people.

15.verse: Simon Peter was following Jesus along with another disciple. Since that disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest,

16.verse: but Peter remained outside at the door. So the other disciple, the one who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the servant girl who kept watch at the door, and brought Peter in.

17.verse: The servant girl who kept watch at the door said to Peter, “You are not one of that man’s disciples, are you?” He answered, “I am not.”

18.verse: The servants and officers had made a charcoal fire, because it was cold, and were standing there and warming themselves, and Peter also was standing with them and warming himself.

19.verse: Meanwhile the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.

20.verse: Jesus answered him, “I have spoken openly to the world. I have always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where all Jews come together. I have said nothing in secret.

21.verse: Why do you question me? Question those who have heard as to what I said to them; they know what I said.”

22.verse: When he said this, one of the officers standing there gave Jesus a slap in the face, saying, “Is that how you answer the high priest?”

23.verse: Jesus replied, “If I spoke incorrectly, testify about the error; but if I spoke correctly, why do you hit me?”

24.verse: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.

25.verse: Now Simon Peter was still standing and warming himself, so they said to him, “You are not one of his disciples, are you?” Peter denied it and said, “I am not!”

26.verse: One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “I saw you in the garden with him, did I not?”

27.verse: Then Peter denied it again, and immediately a rooster began to crow.

28.verse: Then they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the governor’s headquarters. It was early, and they did not go into the governor’s headquarters so that they would not be defiled, but could eat the Passover meal.

29.verse: So Pilate came outside to them and said, “What accusation are you bringing against this man?”

30.verse: They replied to him, saying, “If this man were not doing something wrong, we would not have handed him over to you.”

31.verse: Then Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him according to your law.” The Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put any one to death.”

32.verse: This was to fulfill the word that Jesus had spoken indicating what kind of death he was going to die.

33.verse: Then Pilate entered his headquarters again, summoned Jesus and said to him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”

34.verse: Jesus responded, “Are you saying this of your own accord, or did others tell you about me?”

35.verse: Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own people and the chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”

36.verse: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world; if my kingdom were of this world, my subjects would be fighting to prevent me from being handed over to the Jews; but as it is my kingdom is not from here.”

37.verse: Therefore Pilate said to him, “So you are a king, then?” Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king! The reason for which I was born and have come into the world, is that I should bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”

38.verse: Pilate said to him, “What is truth?” And having said this he went out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no basis for an accusation against him.

39.verse: But you have a custom that I should release someone for you at the Passover. So do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”

40.verse: They shouted back, saying, “Not that man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.

1.verse: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.

2.verse: And the soldiers twisted some thorns into a crown and placed it on his head, and they threw a purple robe around him.

3.verse: Then they kept coming up to him, saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!” and slapping him in the face.

4.verse: Once more Pilate went out and said to them, “Look, I am bringing him out to you that you may know that I find no basis for an accusation against him.”

5.verse: So Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe; and Pilate said to them, “Look, the man!”

6.verse: When the chief priests and the officers saw him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and crucify him; for I find no basis for an accusation against him.”

7.verse: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law he ought to die, because he claimed himself to be the Son of God.”

8.verse: Now when Pilate heard this statement, he became even more afraid.

9.verse: He went back into his headquarters and said to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.

10.verse: So Pilate said to him, “Are you not going to talk to me? You know, do you not, that I have the authority to release you and I have the authority to crucify you?”

11.verse: Jesus said, “You would have no authority over me at all unless it had been given you from above. That is why the man who handed me over to you has a greater sin.”

12.verse: From that point on Pilate tried to release him, but the Jews kept shouting out, saying, “If you release this man, you are no ‘Friend of Caesar.’ Anyone who claims himself to be a king opposes Caesar.”

13.verse: On hearing these words, Pilate brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge’s bench in the place called “Stone Pavement,” or in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”

14.verse: Now it was the day of Preparation for the Passover, about noon. Pilate said to the Jews, “Here is your king!”

15.verse: But they shouted, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your king?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”

16.verse: Then Pilate handed him over to the soldiers to be crucified. So they took charge of Jesus,

17.verse: who, carrying the cross by himself, went out to what was called “The Place of the Skull,” which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha.”

18.verse: There they crucified him, and with him two others, one on either side with Jesus between them.

19.verse: And Pilate wrote an inscription and fastened it to the cross. It read, “Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”

20.verse: Many of the Jews read this inscription, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

21.verse: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but rather, ‘This man said, I am King of the Jews.’”

22.verse: Pilate answered, “What I have written I have written.”

23.verse: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his garments and separated them into four shares, one share for each soldier. They also took his tunic, which was seamless, woven from top to bottom as a single piece.

24.verse: So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it to see who will get it”—that the Scripture might be fulfilled that says, “They divided my garments among themselves, and for my clothing they cast lots.” So the soldiers did these things.

25.verse: Now standing beside Jesus’ cross were his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, look, your son!”

27.verse: Then he said to his disciple, “Look, your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home.

28.verse: After this Jesus, knowing that all was now accomplished, so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.”

29.verse: A jar full of sour wine was there, so they attached a sponge soaked in the sour wine to a stalk of hyssop and held it to his mouth.

30.verse: When he had taken the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is accomplished!” And he bowed his head and handed over his spirit.

31.verse: Then, since it was the day of Preparation, so that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate to have the legs of the crucified men broken and their bodies taken down.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man, then those of the other one who had been crucified with him.

33.verse: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

34.verse: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

35.verse: (The man who saw this has borne witness to it so that you too may believe. His witness is true, and he knows that he is telling the truth.)

36.verse: These things took place so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of his body will be broken.”

37.verse: And yet another Scripture says, “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

38.verse: After this Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus (though a secret one due to his fear of the Jews) asked Pilate if he could remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he came and removed the body.

39.verse: Nicodemus, who earlier had come to Jesus at night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds.

40.verse: So they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in strips of linen with the spices, in accordance with the Jewish custom for burial.

41.verse: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had ever yet been laid.

42.verse: So because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.

1.verse: Now on the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came early to the tomb, while it was still dark, and she saw the stone removed from the tomb.

2.verse: So she went running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken our Master out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put him!”

3.verse: So Peter and the other disciple set out to go to the tomb.

4.verse: The two were running together, but the other disciple ran ahead more quickly than Peter and arrived first at the tomb.

5.verse: When he stooped down to look in, he saw the linen wrappings lying there but he did not go in.

6.verse: Then Simon Peter, who had been behind him, also arrived, and he went right into the tomb. He saw the linen wrappings lying there,

7.verse: and the face cloth that had been on Jesus’ head; it was not lying with the linen wrappings but rolled up in one place by itself.

8.verse: Then the other disciple, the one who had arrived first, also went into the tomb, and he saw and believed.

9.verse: (They still did not understand the Scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.)

10.verse: So the disciples returned to their homes.

11.verse: But Mary stood weeping outside the tomb. As she was weeping she stooped down to look into the tomb.

12.verse: She saw two angels in white sitting there, one at the head and the other at the feet of the place where the body of Jesus had been lying.

13.verse: They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “They have taken away my Master, and I do not know where they have put him.”

14.verse: Having said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who is it that you are looking for?” Thinking that he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you are the one who carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him away.”

16.verse: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to him in Hebrew, “Rabbouni!” (which means “Teacher”).

17.verse: Jesus said to her, “Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. But go to my brothers and say to them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

18.verse: Mary Magdalene went and reported to the disciples, “I have seen the Master!” and she told them that he had said these things to her.

19.verse: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, when the doors were locked where the disciples were for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace be with you.”

20.verse: Having said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were filled with joy when they saw the Lord.

21.verse: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, I also am sending you.”

22.verse: Having said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.verse: Whoever’s sins you forgive, they stand forgiven; whoever’s sins you pronounce unforgiven, they remain unforgiven.

24.verse: But Thomas (called the Twin), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: So the other disciples kept saying to him, “We have seen the Master!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the mark of the nails, and put my finger into the wound left by the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe!”

26.verse: Eight days later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood in their midst and said, “Peace be with you.”

27.verse: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and examine my hands; and reach out your hand, and put it into my side. Do not continue in unbelief, but believe.”

28.verse: Thomas replied to him, saying, “My Lord, and my God!”

29.verse: Jesus said to them, “You believe because you have seen me. Blessed are those who have not seen me, yet believe.”

30.verse: Now Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book;

31.verse: but these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.

1.verse: After this Jesus again revealed himself to his disciples by the Sea of Tiberias, and he revealed himself in this way.

2.verse: Gathered there together were Simon Peter, Thomas (called the Twin), Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two more of his disciples.

3.verse: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” They said to him, “We will go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: Now when morning had dawned, there stood Jesus on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus.

5.verse: So Jesus called to them, “Boys, you have not caught any fish, have you?” They called back to him, “No.”

6.verse: He said to them, “Cast your net to the right side of the boat and you will catch some.” So they cast it there, and then they were not able to haul in the net, because of the large number of fish.

7.verse: Then that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he tucked in his outer garment (for he was wearing nothing underneath), and jumped into the sea.

8.verse: But the other disciples came with the boat, pulling the net full of fish, for they were not far from land, no more than a hundred yards.

9.verse: When they had come ashore, they saw a charcoal fire ready with fish lying on it, and bread.

10.verse: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish that you have just caught.”

11.verse: So Simon Peter went aboard and dragged the net ashore, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty-three of them; and although there were so many, the net was not torn.

12.verse: Jesus said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” Now none of the disciples ventured to ask him, “Who are you?” for they knew it was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and the fish as well.

14.verse: This was now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples after he had been raised from the dead.

15.verse: When they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these others do?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Take care of my lambs.”

16.verse: He said to him again, a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Look after my sheep.”

17.verse: He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” Peter was distressed that Jesus had asked him for the third time, “Do you love me?” He said to him, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Take care of my sheep.

18.verse: I tell you the solemn truth, when you were young, you used to fasten on your clothes and go wherever you wanted, but when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will fasten on your clothes and take you where you do not want to go.”

19.verse: Now he said this to indicate by what kind of death Peter would glorify God. And after saying this he told him, “Follow me!”

20.verse: Peter turned and saw following them the disciple whom Jesus loved, the one who at the supper had leaned back against Jesus and said, “Master, who is it that will betray you?”

21.verse: So when Peter saw him, he said to Jesus, “Lord, and what about him?”

22.verse: Jesus replied, “If I should want him to remain alive until I come back, what concern is that to you? You are to follow me!”

23.verse: So this word spread among the believers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but rather, “If I should want him to remain alive until I come back, what concern is that to you?”

24.verse: This is the disciple who is bearing witness about these things and who wrote these things, and we know that his witness is true.

25.verse: Now there are many other things which Jesus did as well; if they were written down one after the other, I imagine that not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written.
